definition: household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: That good for nothing never sends any money to his poor mother.
sentences.chinese: 那个没用的家伙，从不给他可怜的母亲送钱。

sentences.english: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing.
sentences.chinese: 人是一种最可怜的家伙，什么都产不了，只会挥霍。

sentences.english: Hey fellas have you heard the news?
sentences.chinese: 嘿家伙你听到这个消息？

sentences.english: He always borrows money from others but the repayment is on the Greek calends .
sentences.chinese: 当心那家伙，他总是找别人借钱，但是从不还钱。

sentences.english: Well,I suppose one possibility would be to say the guy in New York is Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 我猜其中一个可能性会是，纽约家伙是拿破仑。

sentences.english: Sb. could fall into shit and come up smelling of roses !
sentences.chinese: 那家伙运气特别好，掉进粪坑里还能拣个金元宝。

sentences.english: Forget it because these guys are usually in a rush.
sentences.chinese: 还是算了吧，这些家伙通常匆匆忙忙。

sentences.english: If you plan on not attending class, make sure you have a buddy that will sign u in.
sentences.chinese: 要是你打算跷课，先保证有个家伙能帮你签到。

sentences.english: This bloke was breaking the unwritten rules for men.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙打破了男人们应该遵守的不成文规则。

sentences.english: This guy looked like a beaten-up spider-monkey mutant.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙看起来活像个蓬头垢面的蜘蛛猴变种人。

sentences.english: Surrounded by guardsoul the little guy can perish the old guy thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 被守护魄环绕着的小家伙能彻底毁灭老家伙。

sentences.english: Surrounded by guardsoul the little guy can perish the old guy thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 被守护魄环绕着的小家伙能彻底毁灭老家伙。

sentences.english: "I was at home taking care of the kids, " she says.
sentences.chinese: “那会儿我正在家里照顾小家伙们”，她说。

sentences.english: Battles between these mega carnivores must have been quite a spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 这些大家伙之间的争斗场面肯定相当壮观。

sentences.english: The only guy who was hard to get to know was Richie Gaspari.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的家伙谁是很难了解的是里奇斯帕里。

definition: (literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
little demon (term of endearment for a child)/mischievous child/imp
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
